doc.title: China MERCH BK (H/A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-30/China MERCH BK HA Core earnings continued to decline on retail banking weaknessChina MERCH BK HA Core earnings continued_2025-08-30

passages.text: PO:47.90 HKD | Price:48.00 HKD

CMB's 1H25 net profit rose \(0.3\%\) YoY to RMB74.9bn, which was \(1.0\%\) below BofA. Pre- provision profit declined \(2.7\%\) YoY and missed by \(1.2\%\) . ROE dropped 1.6ppt YoY to \(13.8\%\) in 1H25, while the CET1 ratio fell 86bp HoH/QoQ to \(14.0\%\) . CMB declared an interim dividend, with payout ratio at \(35\%\) . We trim FY25- 27E earnings by \(1 - 3\%\) , and its A/H share POs by \(- 2\%\) to CNY44.54/HKD47.90. Reiterate Underperform on CMB on its weak core income, premium valuation, and continued challenges in retail banking.

NIM fell by 5bp QoQ to \(1.86\%\) in 2Q25. Net interest income edged up \(0.2\%\) QoQ, with gross interest income/expense falling \(1.3\% /3.4\%\) QoQ, respectively. Loan growth weakened to \(- 0.1\%\) QoQ or \(+5.5\%\) YoY by 1H25. Corporate loans, retail loans, and discounted bills rose \(+8.1\%\) , \(+0.9\%\) , and \(- 8.2\%\) HoH, accounting for \(95\%\) , \(15\%\) and \(- 14\%\) of the net new loans in 1H, respectively. Mortgages rose \(1.4\%\) HoH, while card loans fell \(2.5\%\) HoH, and personal operating loans/consumptions loan rose \(2.2\% /4.8\%\) HoH. Deposits grew \(1.1\%\) QoQ or \(8.8\%\) YoY, driven mainly by time deposits (up \(11\%\) YoY). Fees fell \(1.9\%\) YoY in 1H25 (vs \(- 2.5\%\) in 1Q25). Agency fees rose \(5.5\%\) YoY, while card fees dropped another \(16\%\) YoY in 1H25, following the \(- 14\%\) YoY decline in FY24. Revenue declined \(1.8\%\) YoY and operating cost rose \(0.1\%\) YoY (staff cost was \(- 0.8\%\) YoY). Cost- income ratio rose 0.6ppt to \(33.5\%\) in 1H25.

NPL size declined \(0.6\%\) QoQ or rose \(1.2\%\) HoH. NPL ratio was flattish QoQ at \(0.93\%\) Write- off/gross NPL formation at 59bp/61bp in 1H25 was similar to 59bp/65bp in 1H24. Retail loan NPL ratio rose 7bp HoH, with NPL ratios in mortgage and credit card loans down 2bp/0bp HoH to \(0.46\% /1.75\%\) , while the NPL ratio in developer loans declined 20bp HoH to \(4.74\%\) . Credit cost fell 10bp YoY to 67bp in 1H25. NPL and loan reserve coverage remained high at \(411\%\) and \(3.83\%\) by 1H25. Provision for non- loan assets declined \(14\%\) YoY, and total provisions fell \(8.5\%\) YoY.

Banks-Multinational/Universal

China Merchants Bank is the sixth-largest commercial bank and the largest joint-stock bank in China, with total assets of RMB10.7tn as of 1H23. It was founded in 1987, with China Merchants Group and COSCO as its major shareholders. CMB is a full-service, nationwide bank, employing more than 74,000 staff and operating out of 1,800 branches nationwide. It enjoys strong brand awareness and leadership in China's credit-card business.
We rate CMB Underperform given the declined yield, unattractive valuation, and uninspiring earnings growth in the near-term.

Our adjusted Gordon Growth model- derived PO of HKD47.90 assumes an average ROE of \(12.6\%\) , a medium- term growth rate of \(4.0\%\) , a cost of equity of \(13.0\%\) , and a RMB/US\$ FX rate at 1:7.3 by 2025- end. At our PO, the stock would be trading at 7.8x average 2025- 26E P/E, 0.95x average 2025- 26E P/B or 5.1x average 2025- 26E P/PPOP.
Downside risks to our PO are larger- than- expected margin decline, worse- than- expected slowdown in fee income, and higher- than- expected non- performing loan (NPL) formation.
Upside risks are stronger- than- expected margin performance, faster- than- expected fee income growth, and lower- than- expected NPL formation.

Our adjusted Gordon Growth model- derived PO of CNY45.54 assumes an average ROE of \(12.6\%\) , a medium- term growth rate of \(4.0\%\) , a cost of equity of \(13.0\%\) . At our PO, the stock would be trading at 7.8x average 2025- 26E P/E, 0.95x average 2025- 26E P/B or 5.1x average 2025- 26E P/PPOP.
Downside risks to our PO are larger- than- expected margin decline, worse- than- expected slowdown in fee income, and higher- than- expected non- performing loan (NPL) formation.
Upside risks are stronger- than- expected margin performance, faster- than- expected fee income growth, and lower- than- expected NPL formation.

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0- 12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
Investment ratingTotal return expectation (within 12-month period of date of initial rating)Ratings dispersion guidelines for coverage clusterR2Buy≥ 10%≤ 70%Neutral≥ 0%≤ 30%UnderperformN/A≥ 20%
R2Ratings dispersions may vary from time to time where BofA Global Research believes it better reflects the investment prospects of stocks in a Coverage Cluster.

INCOME RATINGS, indicators of potential cash dividends, are: 7 - same/higher (dividend considered to be secure), 8 - same/lower (dividend not considered to be secure) and 9 - pays no cash dividend. Coverage Cluster is comprised of stocks covered by a single analyst or two or more analysts sharing a common industry, sector, region or other classification(s). A stock's coverage cluster is included in the most recent BofA Global Research report referencing the stock.
